resources.string: All hosts files from the defined sources are downloaded, merged with your own lists and installed as one hosts file on your system.
Restores the default hosts file on your system.
Start or stop webserver on localhost to answer requests to blocked hostnames.

Tcpdump is a tool to monitor DNS requests and save them in a log file. You can start it in the background, run applications that display ads, and afterwards analyze the DNS requests using the log file. Possible ad server can then be added to your blacklist.

Either the su binary could not be found or you did not allow root permission for AdAway.

This can happen when your device is not rooted.
You can find information about how to root your device on www.cyanogenmod.com or other Android websites.

You reverted to the default hosts file.
It may be necessary to reboot Android for the changes to take effect.

Do you want to reboot?
(To prevent data loss make sure no app uses the sdcard at the moment!)

Applying was successful.
It may be necessary to reboot Android for the changes to take effect.

Do you want to reboot?
(To prevent data loss make sure no app uses the sdcard at the moment!)
Applying the hosts file to your system failed!\nTry changing the target hosts file in preferences to /data/data/hosts.
Either you are not properly connected to the Internet or one of the hosts sources you want to download is not available. Please check the following URL and change it in your hosts sources:
Never reboot and don\'t show this question next time!
AdAway is an open source ad blocker for Android.
Some icons are taken from \'Dropbox Emblems Tango by Charles A.\' and \'www.androidicons.com\' (Both licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported).
AdAway uses \'RootTools\' (License: GPL v2) Library to handle root access and \'ActionBarSherlock\' (License: Apache 2.0) to provide an ActionBar for Android < 3.0.
AdAway 를 재시작해야 새롭게 추가한 항목이 적용됩니다!
Exported all entries to a file called \'adaway-export\' on your sdcard.
Symlink from your target to /system/etc/hosts is not existing or incorrect! AdAway will not work if it is not pointing to the right file.\n\nDo you want to try creating a symlink?
Not enough space on the partition!\nTry changing the target hosts file in preferences to /data/data/hosts.
Remounting the partition as read/write failed!

Symlink was created successful.
It may be necessary to reboot Android for the changes to take effect.

Do you want to reboot?
(To prevent data loss make sure no app uses the sdcard at the moment!)

Symlink could not be created by Android.
This fails mostly due to a 'feature' called S-ON on HTC phones!

A solution is to boot your phone into recovery mode and create the symlink there with 'ln -s /data/data/hosts /system/etc/hosts'.

If this does not work search the Internet for S-OFF and your phone.
Please read Help for more information.

A APN proxy is set on your Android!\nAdAway will not work reliable when on Mobile Networks like 3G. You can deactivate that proxy by going to your selected APN (On Android 4: Wireless and networks -> More... -> Mobile Networks -> Access Point Names) and remove the value in the proxy field.
No text editor could be found to open the hosts file. You can install Jota or other text editors to handle this.\n\nDo you want to install Jota?
No file manager could be found to open files. You can install OI File Manager or other file managers to handle this.\n\nDo you want to install OI File Manager?
Do you find this application useful?\nSupport it\'s development by flattring it or sending donations using Google Android Market!
• Flattr takes 10 % as a monthly fee!
In-App Donations are not supported. Is Google Android Market installed correctly?
• Google takes 30 % off every donation!\n• There is no premium version for donators.
• You can choose how much you want to donate after clicking the button!
Thanks for donating!\nI really appreciate this!
Hostname was added to your Blacklist!
Hostname was added to your Whitelist!
Long press one hostname to add it to your Black- or Whitelist!
Before changing this setting, read Help about this functionality.
All blocked hostnames are redirected to this IP address.
Hides the dialog that asks to reboot Android after successful applying
Start webserver on boot delayed with 5 seconds listening on local IP addresses
Enables webserver listening on local IP addresses to answer requests to blocked hostnames
Only used if target hosts file is set to custom target
Check for updates on start of AdAway
This feature will not work correctly when AdAway is installed on sdcard!
Check for updates daily in background with notifications
Update automatically in background if updates are available.
Allow redirection rules from Hosts Sources.
You need to restart AdAway for this setting to take effect.
